segment.source: Windows 10 infrastructure requirements (Windows 10)
segment.target: Windows 10 infrastructure requirements (Windows 10)

segment.source: There are specific infrastructure requirements to deploy and manage Windows 10 that should be in place prior to significant Windows 10 deployments within your organization.
segment.target: There are specific infrastructure requirements to deploy and manage Windows 10 that should be in place prior to significant Windows 10 deployments within your organization.

segment.source: Windows 10 infrastructure requirements
segment.target: Windows 10 infrastructure requirements

segment.source: Applies to
segment.target: Applies to

segment.source: Windows 10
segment.target: Windows 10

segment.source: There are specific infrastructure requirements to deploy and manage Windows 10 that should be in place prior to significant Windows 10 deployments within your organization.
segment.target: There are specific infrastructure requirements to deploy and manage Windows 10 that should be in place prior to significant Windows 10 deployments within your organization.

segment.source: High-level requirements
segment.target: High-level requirements

segment.source: For initial Windows 10 deployments, as well as subsequent Windows 10 upgrades, ensure that sufficient disk space is available for distribution of the Windows 10 installation files (about 3 GB for Windows 10 x64 images, slightly smaller for x86).
segment.target: For initial Windows 10 deployments, as well as subsequent Windows 10 upgrades, ensure that sufficient disk space is available for distribution of the Windows 10 installation files (about 3 GB for Windows 10 x64 images, slightly smaller for x86).

segment.source: Also, be sure to take into account the network impact of moving these large images to each PC; you may need to leverage local server storage.
segment.target: Also, be sure to take into account the network impact of moving these large images to each PC; you may need to leverage local server storage.

segment.source: For persistent VDI environments, carefully consider the I/O impact from upgrading large numbers of PCs in a short period of time.
segment.target: For persistent VDI environments, carefully consider the I/O impact from upgrading large numbers of PCs in a short period of time.

segment.source: Ensure that upgrades are performed in smaller numbers, or during off-peak time periods.
segment.target: Ensure that upgrades are performed in smaller numbers, or during off-peak time periods.

segment.source: (For pooled VDI environments, a better approach is to replace the base image with a new version.)
segment.target: (For pooled VDI environments, a better approach is to replace the base image with a new version.)

segment.source: Deployment tools
segment.target: Deployment tools

segment.source: A new version of the Assessment and Deployment Toolkit (ADK) has been released to support Windows 10.
segment.target: A new version of the Assessment and Deployment Toolkit (ADK) has been released to support Windows 10.

segment.source: This new version, available for download here, is required for Windows 10; you should not use earlier versions of the ADK to deploy Windows 10.
segment.target: This new version, available for download here, is required for Windows 10; you should not use earlier versions of the ADK to deploy Windows 10.

segment.source: It also supports the deployment of Windows 7, Windows 8, and Windows 8.1.
segment.target: It also supports the deployment of Windows 7, Windows 8, and Windows 8.1.

segment.source: Significant enhancements in the ADK for Windows 10 include new runtime provisioning capabilities, which leverage the Windows Imaging and Configuration Designer (Windows ICD), as well as updated versions of existing deployment tools (DISM, USMT, Windows PE, and more).
segment.target: Significant enhancements in the ADK for Windows 10 include new runtime provisioning capabilities, which leverage the Windows Imaging and Configuration Designer (Windows ICD), as well as updated versions of existing deployment tools (DISM, USMT, Windows PE, and more).

segment.source: Microsoft Deployment Toolkit 2013 Update 1, available for download here, has also been updated to support Windows 10 and the new ADK; older versions do not support Windows 10.
segment.target: Microsoft Deployment Toolkit 2013 Update 1, available for download here, has also been updated to support Windows 10 and the new ADK; older versions do not support Windows 10.

segment.source: New in this release is task sequence support for Windows 10 in-place upgrades.
segment.target: New in this release is task sequence support for Windows 10 in-place upgrades.

segment.source: For System Center Configuration Manager, Windows 10 support is offered with various releases:
segment.target: For System Center Configuration Manager, Windows 10 support is offered with various releases:

segment.source: Release
segment.target: Release

segment.source: Windows 10 management?
segment.target: Windows 10 management?

segment.source: Windows 10 deployment?
segment.target: Windows 10 deployment?

segment.target: System Center Configuration Manager 2007

segment.target: Yes, with a hotfix

segment.source: No
segment.target: No

segment.target: System Center Configuration Manager 2012

segment.target: Yes, with SP2 and CU1

segment.target: Yes, with SP2, CU1, and the ADK for Windows 10

segment.target: System Center Configuration Manager 2012 R2

segment.target: Yes, with SP1 and CU1

segment.source: Yes, with SP1, CU1, and the ADK for Windows 10
segment.target: Yes, with SP1, CU1, and the ADK for Windows 10

segment.source: For more details about System Center Configuration Manager support for Windows 10, see Deploy Windows 10 with System Center 2012 R2 Configuration Manager.
segment.target: For more details about System Center Configuration Manager support for Windows 10, see Deploy Windows 10 with System Center 2012 R2 Configuration Manager.

segment.source: Management tools
segment.target: Management tools

segment.source: In addition to System Center Configuration Manager, Windows 10 also leverages other tools for management.
segment.target: In addition to System Center Configuration Manager, Windows 10 also leverages other tools for management.

segment.source: For Windows Server and Active Directory, existing supported versions are fully supported for Windows 10.
segment.target: For Windows Server and Active Directory, existing supported versions are fully supported for Windows 10.

segment.source: New Group Policy templates will be needed to configure new settings available in Windows 10; these templates are available in the Windows 10 media images, and are available as a separate download here.
segment.target: New Group Policy templates will be needed to configure new settings available in Windows 10; these templates are available in the Windows 10 media images, and are available as a separate download here.

segment.source: See Group Policy settings reference for a list of the new and modified policy settings.
segment.target: See Group Policy settings reference for a list of the new and modified policy settings.

segment.source: If you are using a central policy store, follow the steps outlined here to update the ADMX files stored in that central store.
segment.target: If you are using a central policy store, follow the steps outlined here to update the ADMX files stored in that central store.

segment.source: No new Active Directory schema updates or specific functional levels are currently required for core Windows 10 product functionality, although subsequent upgrades could require these to support new features.
segment.target: No new Active Directory schema updates or specific functional levels are currently required for core Windows 10 product functionality, although subsequent upgrades could require these to support new features.

segment.source: Microsoft Desktop Optimization Pack (MDOP) has been updated to support Windows 10.
segment.target: Microsoft Desktop Optimization Pack (MDOP) has been updated to support Windows 10.

segment.source: The minimum versions required to support Windows 10 are as follows:
segment.target: The minimum versions required to support Windows 10 are as follows:

segment.target: Product

segment.target: Advanced Group Policy Management (AGPM)

segment.source: For more information, see the MDOP TechCenter.
segment.target: For more information, see the MDOP TechCenter.

segment.source: For devices you manage with mobile device management (MDM) solutions such as Microsoft Intune, existing capabilities (provided initially in Windows 8.1) are fully supported in Windows 10; new Windows 10 MDM settings and capabilities will require updates to the MDM services.
segment.target: For devices you manage with mobile device management (MDM) solutions such as Microsoft Intune, existing capabilities (provided initially in Windows 8.1) are fully supported in Windows 10; new Windows 10 MDM settings and capabilities will require updates to the MDM services.

segment.source: See Mobile device management for more information.
segment.target: See Mobile device management for more information.

segment.source: Windows Server Update Services (WSUS) requires some additional configuration to receive updates for Windows 10.
segment.target: Windows Server Update Services (WSUS) requires some additional configuration to receive updates for Windows 10.

segment.source: Use the Windows Server Update Services admin tool and follow these instructions:
segment.target: Use the Windows Server Update Services admin tool and follow these instructions:

segment.source: Select the Options node, and then click Products and Classifications.
segment.target: Select the Options node, and then click Products and Classifications.

segment.source: In the Products tree, select the Windows 10 and Windows 10 LTSB products and any other Windows 10-related items that you want.
segment.target: In the Products tree, select the Windows 10 and Windows 10 LTSB products and any other Windows 10-related items that you want.

segment.source: Click OK.
segment.target: Click OK.

segment.source: From the Synchronizations node, right-click and choose Synchronize Now.
segment.target: From the Synchronizations node, right-click and choose Synchronize Now.

segment.source: figure 1
segment.target: figure 1

segment.source: Figure 1.
segment.target: Figure 1.

segment.source: WSUS product list with Windows 10 choices
segment.target: WSUS product list with Windows 10 choices

segment.source: Because Windows 10 updates are cumulative in nature, each month’s new update will supersede the previous month's.
segment.target: Because Windows 10 updates are cumulative in nature, each month’s new update will supersede the previous month's.

segment.source: Consider leveraging “express installation” packages to reduce the size of the payload that needs to be sent to each PC each month; see Express installation files for more information.
segment.target: Consider leveraging “express installation” packages to reduce the size of the payload that needs to be sent to each PC each month; see Express installation files for more information.

segment.source: (Note that this will increase the amount of disk storage needed by WSUS, and impacts all operating systems being managed with WSUS.)
segment.target: (Note that this will increase the amount of disk storage needed by WSUS, and impacts all operating systems being managed with WSUS.)

segment.source: Activation
segment.target: Activation

segment.source: Windows 10 volume license editions of Windows 10 will continue to support all existing activation methods (KMS, MAK, and AD-based activation).
segment.target: Windows 10 volume license editions of Windows 10 will continue to support all existing activation methods (KMS, MAK, and AD-based activation).

segment.source: An update will be required for existing KMS servers:
segment.target: An update will be required for existing KMS servers:

segment.source: Product
segment.target: Product

segment.source: Required update
segment.target: Required update

segment.source: Windows 10
segment.target: Windows 10

segment.source: None
segment.target: None

segment.source: Windows Server 2012 R2 and Windows 8.1
segment.target: Windows Server 2012 R2 and Windows 8.1

segment.source: https://support.microsoft.com/kb/3058168
segment.target: https://support.microsoft.com/kb/3058168

segment.source: Windows Server 2012 and Windows 8
segment.target: Windows Server 2012 and Windows 8

segment.source: https://support.microsoft.com/kb/3058168
segment.target: https://support.microsoft.com/kb/3058168

segment.source: Windows Server 2008 R2 and Windows 7
segment.target: Windows Server 2008 R2 and Windows 7

segment.source: Available by October 2015
segment.target: Available by October 2015

segment.source: Additionally, new product keys will be needed for all types of volume license activation (KMS, MAK, and AD-based Activation); these keys are available on the Volume Licensing Service Center (VLSC) for customers with rights to the Windows 10 operating system.
segment.target: Additionally, new product keys will be needed for all types of volume license activation (KMS, MAK, and AD-based Activation); these keys are available on the Volume Licensing Service Center (VLSC) for customers with rights to the Windows 10 operating system.

segment.source: To find the needed keys:
segment.target: To find the needed keys:

segment.source: Sign into the Volume Licensing Service Center (VLSC) at with a Microsoft account that has appropriate rights.
segment.target: Sign into the Volume Licensing Service Center (VLSC) at with a Microsoft account that has appropriate rights.

segment.source: For KMS keys, click Licenses and then select Relationship Summary.
segment.target: For KMS keys, click Licenses and then select Relationship Summary.

segment.source: Click the appropriate active license ID, and then select Product Keys near the right side of the page.
segment.target: Click the appropriate active license ID, and then select Product Keys near the right side of the page.

segment.source: For KMS running on Windows Server, find the Windows Srv 2012R2 DataCtr/Std KMS for Windows 10 product key; for KMS running on client operating systems, find the Windows 10 product key.
segment.target: For KMS running on Windows Server, find the Windows Srv 2012R2 DataCtr/Std KMS for Windows 10 product key; for KMS running on client operating systems, find the Windows 10 product key.

segment.source: For MAK keys, click Downloads and Keys, and then filter the list by using Windows 10 as a product.
segment.target: For MAK keys, click Downloads and Keys, and then filter the list by using Windows 10 as a product.

segment.source: Click the Key link next to an appropriate list entry (for example, Windows 10 Enterprise or Windows 10 Enterprise LTSB) to view the available MAK keys.
segment.target: Click the Key link next to an appropriate list entry (for example, Windows 10 Enterprise or Windows 10 Enterprise LTSB) to view the available MAK keys.

segment.source: (You can also find keys for KMS running on Windows 10 in this list.
segment.target: (You can also find keys for KMS running on Windows 10 in this list.

segment.source: These keys will not work on Windows servers running KMS.)
segment.target: These keys will not work on Windows servers running KMS.)

segment.source: Note that Windows 10 Enterprise and Windows 10 Enterprise LTSB installations use different MAK keys.
segment.target: Note that Windows 10 Enterprise and Windows 10 Enterprise LTSB installations use different MAK keys.

segment.source: But you can use the same KMS server or Active Directory-based activation environment for both; the KMS keys obtained from the Volume Licensing Service Center will work with both.
segment.target: But you can use the same KMS server or Active Directory-based activation environment for both; the KMS keys obtained from the Volume Licensing Service Center will work with both.
